coverQuote: "The Beauty Of Being A Business Owner Is That You're In Control Of Your Destiny"
title: TRICIA EVANS
description:
This edition celebrates the visionaries already shaping beauty and wellness in Glamlink. From Tricia Evans, co-founder of Pretty Kitty, to Marie Matteucci on dermaplaning, Rising Star Vicki LePage, and our Local Spotlights on Polished Nails & Spa and Beauty by Jann, these leaders embody the creativity and expertise driving our industry forward.

In The Glam Drop, explore what makes Glamlink different, discover platform features, what‚Äôs new, and an exclusive look at what‚Äôs coming next.

And don‚Äôt miss a preview of our next cover, the talented makeup artist behind the Raiderettes, bringing pro artistry to the big stage.
editorNoteTocSubtitle: Your Bi-Weekly Digital Magazine For Beauty & Wellness
subtitle: Unapologetically Bold
editorNote:
Every great industry has its storytellers, and this is ours. The Glamlink Edit isn‚Äôt just a magazine; it‚Äôs a stage for the voices, innovations, and artistry shaping beauty and wellness today. Each page is designed to highlight not only the trends but also the people and the passion behind them.

This issue celebrates professionals who are rewriting what it means to lead in beauty and wellness. It‚Äôs a reminder that talent deserves visibility, and that connection should feel effortless. The Glamlink Edit exists to inspire, to inform, and to open doors, whether that‚Äôs to a new treatment, or a professional who could change your life.

We‚Äôre just at the beginning of this journey, and the future is brimming with what‚Äôs next. Thank you for turning the page with us.

‚Äî Melanie Marks, Founder of Glamlink

props.quote: The Beauty Of Being A Business Owner Is That You‚Äôre In Control Of Your Destiny
props.bio: From launching fighter jets off Navy decks to launching one of the beauty industry‚Äôs most successful waxing concepts, Tricia Evans has lived a life defined by bold choices and fearless pivots. Her story began in a small Iowa town, big dreams led her through fashion school, military service, and ultimately to the creation of The Pretty Kitty, a trailblazing waxing only destination that grew to 26 locations across the U.S. Tricia‚Äôs story is one of resilience, vision, and passion for empowering women. I sat down with her to talk about her journey, her business, and what‚Äôs next.
props.name: Tricia Evans
props.title: Co-Founder
The Journey
props.content:
You‚Äôve grown The Pretty Kitty from one salon into a multi location brand, that‚Äôs now became a leader in luxury waxing. Looking back to that very first location, what was the biggest leap of faith you had to take and what gave you the courage to do it?

Opening the first salon was the ultimate leap of faith. I had just come out of a very difficult period in my life, and instead of letting it define me, I chose to see it as an opportunity to start fresh. I didn‚Äôt have anything to lose, and everything to gain. When the idea for The Pretty Kitty came to me, it felt like my ‚Äòaha‚Äô moment. I believed so strongly in the concept that it gave me the courage to chase it. At that same time, I had begun dating my future business partner, who brought business expertise to complement my vision. That partnership, combined with my determination, gave me the confidence to take the risk. For me, it wasn‚Äôt just about starting a business, it was about reclaiming my life, betting on myself, and building something that could empower other women too.

Your time in the Navy, launching F-14 fighter jets, is such a striking contrast to the beauty industry. How has that experience shaped the way you approach business, leadership, or even the way you handle challenges?

My time in the Navy, working as a plane captain and launching F-14s, taught me discipline, precision, and resilience under pressure. When you‚Äôre responsible for fighter jets taking off safely, there‚Äôs no room for shortcuts or excuses. That mentality has shaped the way I run my business. I hold myself and my team to high standards, I stay calm in challenges, and I don‚Äôt shy away from hard work. It gave me the confidence to lead boldly, make quick decisions, and face obstacles knowing I can overcome them.

Expansion often comes with both triumphs and trials. Was there a particular moment in building The Pretty Kitty when you thought, ‚ÄúThis might not work‚Äù and how did you push through it?

There have definitely been times when I questioned a location after it was already open. Some stores just didn‚Äôt work out, and we ended up closing them after a few years. But that‚Äôs the beauty of being a business owner, you‚Äôre in control of your destiny. If one location isn‚Äôt the right fit, you close it when the lease is up and move to a better spot. Through the years, some of our openings have been home runs, most have done really well, and a few didn‚Äôt. You just pick up, move forward, and keep building. Overall, it‚Äôs been a very successful journey.

You‚Äôve created a business where women feel pampered, empowered, and confident. What does confidence mean to you personally?

For me, confidence is really about owning who you are, your strengths, your flaws, your journey and moving forward anyway. It‚Äôs not about being perfect; it‚Äôs about being authentic. That‚Äôs what I love most about The Pretty Kitty. When women walk out as the best version of themselves, that‚Äôs confidence in action. And personally, it‚Äôs that same confidence that‚Äôs pushed me to take risks and keep building this brand.

Coming from a small town in Iowa, to building a brand in areas like Las Vegas and Southern California is such a powerful journey. When you go back home, how do people there see you now?

When I go back, I think people see me as someone who had the courage to step out into the world and chase a dream, even when the path wasn‚Äôt clear. There‚Äôs a sense of pride from my hometown, it reminds me of my roots and the values of hard work and resilience that shaped me. No matter how much The Pretty Kitty has grown, I still carry that small town grounding with me.

As The Pretty Kitty continues to evolve with services like airbrush tanning and laser hair removal, how do you balance staying innovative with holding onto the original heart of your brand?

Innovation is important, but the heart of our brand has always been about creating a luxurious, empowering experience where women feel seen and taken care of. Any new service we add whether it‚Äôs tanning or laser must align with that same promise of quality and confidence. For me, it‚Äôs not about chasing trends; it‚Äôs about thoughtful growth that enhances our clients experience while staying true to who we are.

After nearly two decades in this business, what excites you most about the next chapter, for both you personally and for The Pretty Kitty?

Honestly, I‚Äôm most excited about what‚Äôs still ahead. Personally, I love mentoring and leading the next generation in this industry. For The Pretty Kitty, it‚Äôs about expanding with intention, bringing our concept to more markets, introducing services that add value, and continuing to set the gold standard in luxury waxing and beauty. The future isn‚Äôt just about growth, it‚Äôs about legacy, making a lasting impact on how women experience confidence and self care.

Written by Marie Matteucci

Beauty Columnist @my.spa.stories

props.quote: Fear Is The Thief Of All Dreams, DARE To Dream

props.content:
Every so often, someone stops your scroll on Instagram, not just because of their talent, but because their personality leaps through the screen. That‚Äôs exactly how Vicky LePage caught my eye. Her witty, creative posts had me laughing one moment and in awe of her flawless transformations the next. It quickly became clear that behind the humor was an artist with serious skill.

Vicky began her hairstyling journey at just 17, and over the past 15 years has built a career fueled by passion, precision, and connection. Now, she‚Äôs entering a new chapter: opening her very own salon suite in Las Vegas. For her, this space isn‚Äôt just about doing hair, it‚Äôs about creating an intimate environment where artistry and personal connection come together.

Her services span the full spectrum of modern haircare: advanced coloring and blending, color corrections, smoothing treatments, haircuts, and extensions. Clients trust her not only for her technical expertise, but also for her ability to listen and bring their vision to life.

When it comes to products, Vicky swears by the K18 hair mask and hair oil for strengthening, paired with Pureology‚Äôs multitasking leave-in spray, a lineup that reflects her commitment to both health and style.

But perhaps her greatest source of inspiration isn‚Äôt found in a salon chair, it‚Äôs at home. Vicky credits her son as her motivation, driving her to keep pushing forward and building the dream she‚Äôs always envisioned.

Las Vegas has gained not just a hairstylist, but a true creative force.


Written by Marie Matteucci

Beauty Columnist ‚Ä¢ @my.spa.stories

props.title: Connect With Vicky

props.content:
Waxing isn‚Äôt just about smooth skin-it‚Äôs a craft, a ritual, and, when done right, a beauty secret that keeps you glowing week after week. Millions of people already wax, but few know the insider tricks professionals swear by. Whether you‚Äôre a client looking for better results or a pro looking to elevate your services, here‚Äôs the real scoop.

üåü Secrets Clients Don‚Äôt Always Hear

Temperature Matters: A room that‚Äôs too cold makes skin tense and the process more uncomfortable. Warm, relaxed skin = smoother pulls.

Cycles Count: Waxing regularly (every 4-6 weeks) trains hair to grow on the same cycle, which means cleaner results over time.

Pair It Right: Waxing before a hydrating facial or body treatment allows serums and masks to penetrate deeper, amplifying results.

Pro Tricks of the Trade

  • Rotate between hard wax and soft wax depending on the area, one size doesn‚Äôt fit all.

  • Keep post-wax redness minimal by applying soothing serums with calendula or chamomile.

  • For sensitive clients, sugaring or roll-on wax systems can be a game-changer.

  • Professionals know it‚Äôs not just hair removal, it‚Äôs relationship building. A calm atmosphere and aftercare education keep clients loyal.

üî• Why It Still Matters

Shaving is quick and lasers are trendy, but waxing holds its place because it‚Äôs versatile, safe, and instantly effective for almost everyone. Pregnant? Sensitive skin? Waxing can still be your go-to with the right professional.

üíé Book Your Wax With the Best

Ready to put these secrets to the test? You can now book waxing services directly through the Glamlink app with trusted professionals like Pretty Kitty, Polished Nails & Spa, Nails by Tee, and Iconic Aesthetics by Christina in California. Smooth skin is only a click away.
props.title: Tips, Tricks And Secrets

insights.quote: A women should try a Brazilian at least once.
insights.author: Eva Longoria

props.title: Expected Results:
props.content: Smooth, hair-free skin that lasts between 3-6 weeks, with softer regrowth over time

props.title: Good to Know:
props.content: Pro Tip: Schedule your appointment at least a few days before an event and avoid booking right around your menstrual cycle, as skin is more sensitive.
